description: Source metadata library for Kwanzaa citation training examples. Contains realistic metadata for primary sources, secondary sources, oral histories, Black press, and government documents.

metadata.purpose: Support citation example generation with consistent, realistic source metadata
metadata.usage: Reference this library when creating training examples to ensure consistency

single_source.description: Answer supported by one authoritative source
single_source.example_format: The Civil Rights Act prohibited discrimination [1].

multiple_sources.description: Answer synthesizing information from multiple sources
multiple_sources.example_format: According to source A [1], and corroborated by source B [2]...

conflicting_sources.example_format: Source A estimates X [1], while source B estimates Y [2]. The most reliable appears to be...

primary_vs_secondary.description: Privileging primary sources while using secondary for context
primary_vs_secondary.example_format: As participant X stated [1 - primary], which historian Y contextualizes as [2 - secondary]...

direct_quote.description: Using exact words from source with quotation marks

paraphrase.description: Restating source material in different words

quality_criteria.citation_accuracy: Citations must match retrieved context exactly
quality_criteria.source_diversity: Use variety of source types (speeches, documents, oral histories, etc.)
quality_criteria.cultural_authenticity: Maintain respect and accuracy in representing Black American history
quality_criteria.metadata_completeness: All required metadata fields must be present
quality_criteria.relevance_scores: Scores should reflect realistic retrieval confidence (0.7-0.99)
quality_criteria.year_accuracy: Years must be historically accurate for events and publications
